content:
Thunderbird for Android does not have address book on its own, and it uses the address book of your Android phone.

The following link might be helpful: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1484999#answer-1702948
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content: "Settings" > "Accounts" section > tap the account you want to configure > "Sending mail" > tick "Upload sent messages (Upload sent messages to Sent folder after sending)".
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content:
Through trial and error, I finally found the solution to my question.

Go to Settings, select the desired account name, then select "Folders." You will see "auto-expand," then "show only subscribed," then a list of folder names. Most of them will say automatic in italics underneath the name.

Find "Sent folder," click on it, and a popup will be displayed, allowing you to choose a folder name. Unselect Automatic (None) and select Sent. There is no OK button, so go back using the back navigation button, not the cancel button.
creator: bwffx

content: Excellent, thanks for your help. It solved my problem Thanks
creator: robo844
